        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Distribution of government, private and non-domestic expenditure on educational institutions</common:Name>
        <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Répartition des dépenses gouvernementales, privées et internationales consacrées aux établissements d'enseignement</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en">This dataset contains data on government, private and expenditure on educational institutions. Government expenditure can be brokendown by central, regional (state) and local levels of government. Private sector can also be brokendown by households and other non-educational private sector. Expenditure are reported after transfers between entities, transfers can be from higher to lower levels of government, from the government to the private sector, or from non-domestic source to the government. The default table displays expenditure for the general government, the private sector and non-domestic sources in 2020 constant USD PPP (top section), in percentage of GDP (middle section), and in percentage (distribution by sector, in the bottom section), for the combined primary to tertiary levels of education, and for all public and private educational institutions. This can be changed to display data by: level of education, type of educational institution, level of financing source, local currency/USD PPP, and current/constant prices. Please note that the filters are inter related, meaning that selection in one category may impact the possibility to select options in another category. </p><p> Please note that non-domestic expenditure is labelled "Rest of the world".</p><p>For more information, please consult the <a href="https://www.oecd.org/en/publications/education-at-a-glance_19991487.html"><i>Education at a Glance</i></a> web page and the <a href="https://doi.org/10.1787/9789264304444-en"><i>OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications</i></a>.</common:Description>
        <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Cet ensemble de données contient des données sur les dépenses publiques, privées et internationales consacrées aux établissements d'enseignement. Les dépenses publiques peuvent être ventilées par niveaux de gouvernement central, régional et local. Le secteur privé peut également être ventilé entre les ménages et les autres secteurs privés non éducatifs. Les dépenses sont déclarées après transferts entre entités, les transferts peuvent provenir des niveaux supérieurs de gouvernement vers les niveaux inférieurs de gouvernement, du gouvernment vers le secteur privé, ou d'une source internationale vers le gouvernement. Le tableau par défaut affiche les dépenses gouvernementales, du secteur privé et des sources internationales en dollars des É-U PPA constants de 2020 (section supérieure), en pourcentage du PIB (section centrale), et en pourcentage (répartition par secteur, dans la section inférieure), pour les niveaux d'enseignement primaire à tertiaire combinés, et pour les établissements d’enseignement publics et privés combinés. Cela peut être modifié pour afficher les données par : niveau d'éducation, type d'établissement d'enseignement, source de financement plus détaillée, devise locale/dollars des É-U PPA convertis et prix courants/constants. Veuillez noter que les filtres sont interdépendants, ce qui signifie que la sélection dans une catégorie peut avoir un impact sur la possibilité de sélectionner des options dans une autre catégorie </p><p> Veuillez noter que les dépenses internationales sont identifiées comme « Reste du monde ».</p><p>Pour plus d'informations, veuillez consulter la page web <a href="https://www.oecd.org/fr/publications/regards-sur-l-education_19991495.html"><i>Regard sur l'éducation</i></a> et le <a href="https://doi.org/10.1787/9789264305380-fr"><i>Guide de l'OCDE pour l'établissement de statistiques internationalement comparables dans le domaine de l'éducation 2018</i></a>.</common:Description>

      <structure:Codelist id="CL_OBS_STATUS" agencyID="SDMX" version="2.2" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Observation Status</common:Name>
        <structure:Code id="A">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Normal value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used as default value if no value is provided or when no special coded qualification is assumed. Usually, it can be assumed that the source agency assigns sufficient confidence to the provided observation and/or the value is not expected to be dramatically revised.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="B">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Time series break</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observations are characterised as such when different content exists or a different methodology has been applied to this observation as compared with the preceding one (the one given for the previous period).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="D">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Definition differs</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to indicate slight deviations from the established methodology (footnote-type information); these divergences do not imply a break in time series.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="E">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Estimated value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation obtained through an estimation methodology (e.g. to produce back-casts) or based on the use of a limited amount of data or ad hoc sampling and through additional calculations (e.g. to produce a value at an early stage of the production stage while not all data are available). It may also be used in case of experimental data (e.g. in the context of a pilot ahead of a full scale production process) or in case of data of (anticipated/assessed) low quality. If needed, additional information can be provided through free text using the COMMENT_OBS attribute at the observation level or at a higher level. This code is to be used when the estimation is done by a sender agency. When the imputation is carried out by a receiver agency in order to replace or fill gaps in reported data series, the flag to use is I "Value imputed by a receiving agency".</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="F">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Forecast value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Value deemed to assess the magnitude which a quantity will assume at some future point of time (as distinct from "estimated value" which attempts to assess the magnitude of an already existent quantity).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="G">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Experimental value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Data collected on the basis of definitions or (alternative) collection methods under development. Data not of guaranteed quality as normally expected from provider.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="I">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Value imputed by a receiving agency</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation imputed by a receiving agency to replace or fill gaps in reported data series. This code is intended to cover all cases where a receiving agency publishes data about a sending agency that do not come from an official source in the sender agency's reporting framework. When the estimation is done by the sender agency, the flag to use is E "Estimated value".</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="K">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Data included in another category</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is used when data for a given category are missing and are included in another category, sub-total or total. Generally where code "K" is used there should be a corresponding code "W - Includes data from another category" assigned to the over-covered category. Implementers and data reporters should use the COMMENT_OBS observation-level attribute to specify under which category the data are included.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Includes data from another category</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is used when data include another category, or go beyond the scope of the data collection and are therefore over-covered. Generally, where code "W" is used there should be a corresponding code "K - Data included in another category" assigned to the category which is under-covered. Implementers and data reporters should use the COMMENT_OBS observation-level attribute to specify which additional data are included.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="O">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is to be used when no breakdown is made between the reasons why data are missing. Data can be missing due to many reasons: data cannot exist, data exist but are not collected (e.g. because they are below a certain threshold or subject to a derogation clause), data are unreliable, etc.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; data cannot exist</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to denote empty cells resulting from the impossibility to collect a statistical value (e.g. a particular education level or type of institution may be not applicable to a given country's education system).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="P">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Provisional value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">An observation is characterised as "provisional" when the source agency - while it bases its calculations on its standard production methodology - considers that the data, almost certainly, are expected to be revised.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="S">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Strike and other special events</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Special circumstances (e.g. strike) affecting the observation or causing a missing value.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="L">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; data exist but were not collected</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used, for example, when some data are not reported/disseminated because they are below a certain threshold.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="H">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; holiday or weekend</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used in some daily data flows.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; suppressed</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used, for example, when data are suppressed due to statistical confidentiality considerations.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="J">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Derogation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Clause in an agreement (e.g. legal act, gentlemen's agreement) stating that some provisions in the agreement are not to be implemented by designated parties; these derogations may affect the observation or cause a missing value. In general, derogations are limited in time.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="N">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Not significant</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to indicate a value which is not a "real" zero (e.g. a result of 0.0004 rounded to zero).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="U">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Low reliability</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This indicates existing observations, but for which the user should also be aware of the low quality assigned.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="V">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unvalidated value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation as received from the respondent without further evaluation of data quality.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>
      <structure:Codelist isPartial="true" id="CL_UNIT_MULT" agencyID="SDMX" version="1.1" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unit Multiplier</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code list provides code values for indicating the magnitude in the units of measurement. More information about this code list and SDMX code lists in general (e.g. list of generic codes for expressing general concepts like "Total", "Unknown", etc.;
          syntaxes for the creation of further codes; general guidelines for the creation of SDMX code lists) can be found at this address: https://sdmx.org/?page_id=4345.</common:Description>
        <structure:Code id="0">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Units</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of zero (10^0)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="6">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Millions</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of six (10^6)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>
    </structure:Codelists>
    <structure:Concepts>
      <structure:ConceptScheme isPartial="true" id="CS_EDU_FIN" agencyID="OECD.EDU.IMEP" version="3.1" isFinal="true">

        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Concept scheme of education finance data</common:Name>
        <structure:Concept id="REF_AREA">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Reference area</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Zone de référence</common:Name>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="MEASURE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Measure</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Mesure</common:Name>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="EDUCATION_LEV">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Education level</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Niveau d'éducation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">An ordered set which groups and classifies education programmes according to the knowledge, skills, competencies and qualifications which they are designed to impart</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Un ensemble ordonné qui regroupe et classe les programmes éducatifs en fonction des connaissances, aptitudes, compétences et qualifications qu'ils sont censés transmettre</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="EXP_SOURCE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Financing source</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Source de financement</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Sector financing education</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Financement sectoriel de l'éducation</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="EXP_DESTINATION">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Destination of expenditure</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Destination des dépenses</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Spending entity</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Entité dépensière</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="EXPENDITURE_TYPE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Type of expenditure</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Type de dépense</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Specifies the type of expenditure data whether direct, transfers, etc</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Spécifie le type de données de dépenses, qu'elles soient directes, transferts, etc.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="PRICE_BASE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Price base</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Type de prix</common:Name>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="BASE_PER">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Base period</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Période de base</common:Name>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="TIME_PERIOD">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Time period</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Période de temps</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Timespan or point in time to which the observation refers.</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Période ou moment auquel l’observation se réfère.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="OBS_VALUE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Observation value</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Valeur d'observation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Value of a particular variable.</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Valeur d'une variable particulière.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="OBS_STATUS">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Observation status</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Statut d'observation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Information on the quality of a value or the type of missing value.</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Informations sur la qualité d'une valeur ou le type de valeur manquante.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="UNIT_MULT">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unit multiplier</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Multiplicateur d'unité</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Exponent in base 10 specified so that multiplying the observation numeric values by 10^UNIT_MULT gives a value expressed in the unit of measure.</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Exposant en base 10 spécifié de telle sorte que la multiplication des valeurs numériques d'observation par 10^UNIT_MULT donne une valeur exprimée dans l'unité de mesure.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="UNIT_MEASURE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unit of measure</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Unité de mesure</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Unit in which the data values are expressed.</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Unité dans laquelle les valeurs des données sont exprimées.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="DECIMALS">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Decimals</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Décimales</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Number of digits of an observation to the right of a decimal point</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Nombre de chiffres d'une observation à droite d'un point décimal</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="Q_SHEET_ROW_ID">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Questionnaire row ID</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Identifiant de ligne dans le questionnaire</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Row ID of the value within the education finance questionnaire.</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Identifiant de la ligne du questionnaire sur les finances de l'éducation.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="Q_SHEET">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Questionnaire sheet</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Feuille du questionnaire</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This is used to identify where the information is coming from in the questionnnaire. It is only used to split information coming from SOURCE and NATURE Excel sheets.</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Ceci est utilisé pour identifier d'où proviennent les informations dans le questionnaire. Il est uniquement utilisé pour diviser les informations provenant des feuilles SOURCE et de NATURE du questionnaire Excel.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
      </structure:ConceptScheme>
    </structure:Concepts>
